byline.original: By AZAM AHMED and JIM YARDLEY
byline.contributor: Paulina Villegas contributed reporting from Chiapas, Mexico.

lead_paragraph: By coming to Ecatepec, one of the country’s largest, poorest and most violent cities, the pope placed himself at the center of Mexico’s identity crisis.

headline.print_headline: In Mexican Slum, Pope Laments Economic Gap
headline.main: In Mexican Slum, Pope Francis Laments Economic Gap

snippet: By coming to Ecatepec, one of the country’s largest, poorest and most violent cities, the pope placed himself at the center of Mexico’s identity crisis.
abstract: Pope Francis presides over outdoor Mass for several hundred thousand people in Mexico City suburb of Ecatepec; visit to Ecatepec, one of country's largest, poorest and most violent cities, illustrates how pope is seeking to draw attention to growing economic inequality throughout Mexico.
